column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

Tend to NACK.\nI prefer having this documentation self-contained and not refer to bitcoin.org.\nYes, mentioning the full-node guide might be useful, but it shouldn't be the sole source of information.

> There is also the question about some of text being misplaced. Phrases like "Bitcoin is a free open source peer-to-peer electronic cash system..." and "Bitcoin Core is the original Bitcoin client..."

I agree about that! The project description belongs in the top-level `README.md`, not there.

In any case especially `README_windows.txt` is meant for people that have shortly ago downloade

The contradictory thing about `doc/README.md` is that it serves two functions:

- it lists the other documentation in `doc/` (as *github* displays this text when browsing to the directory)
- it's copied to the archive to serve as introduction text

These functions are incompatible, and I think a lot of recent changes to these files are based on different ideas of what should be in there,
Closing. The download link was fixed in #15128 and the rest was controversial.
Surround the URL by angle brackets to make sure it is converted to a link by all markdown parsers :-)
